verses.roman:
tāte ei dravye kṛṣṇādhara-sparśa haila
adharera guṇa saba ihāte sañcārila

synonyms: tāte—therefore; ei dravye—in these ingredients; kṛṣṇa-adhara—of the lips of Kṛṣṇa; sparśa—touch; haila—there was; adharera—of the lips; guṇa—attributes; saba—all; ihāte—in these ingredients; sañcārila—have become transferred.
translation: "Therefore, it is to be understood that the spiritual nectar of Kṛṣṇa's lips has touched these ordinary ingredients and transferred to them all their spiritual qualities.

purport.content: Since everyone had previously tasted these ingredients, why had they become extraordinary and spiritually tasteful? This was proof that food, prasāda, becomes uncommonly flavorful and tasteful by touching Kṛṣṇa's lips.
